description.narrative: By 2020, a child rights coordination mechanism with a clearly defined role and capacity for child rights monitoring (CRM) is established, and partnerships are sustained for generation of equity focused data on children with evidence-based programming, which is piloted for addressing gender-biased sex selection (GBSS)., which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research, Evaluation And Research (Covid), Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices (Covid), Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the justice system adequately responds to violations of children's rights, and a system is developed to recognize and prevent violence, abuse and neglect of children.

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Armenia UN Building 14 Petros Adamyan Street Yerevan 0010 Armenia

sector.narrative: Behavioural change communication campaigns on gender equitable roles and practices
Evaluation innovation learning, uptake and partnerships for evaluation
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Armenia (Access to Justice)
UNICEF Programmes in Armenia (Child Rights Monitoring)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Armenia 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, a child rights coordination mechanism with a clearly defined role and capacity for child rights monitoring (CRM) is established, and partnerships are sustained for generation of equity focused data on children with evidence-based programming, which is piloted for addressing gender-biased sex selection (GBSS).

description.narrative: The advocacy for evidence-based policy-making for children and monitoring of child rights with better quality data and evidence continued. Throughout the year the Armenian Statistical Committee (ArmStat) was supported to have better data about children in Armenia and the Human Rights Defender's Office's (HRDO) capacity for independent Child Rights Monitoring (CRM) was strengthened. The experimental research carried out with the University of Zurich on gender based sex selection and the underlying causes was finalized and a working paper was published. The findings together with a Media Consumption study will inform a C4D campaign and interventions. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2020

title.narrative: Number and reach of evidence-based initiatives targeting drivers of gender-biased sex selection and monitoring the change

baseline.value: 0 by UNICEF. Since 2012 many initiatives took off targeting various aspects of GBSS, however the main drivers of GBSS rooted in norms and stereotypes remain to be addressed

target.value: 2020:One set of TV-series is broadcasted reaching at least 50% of the country, and community based C4D activities are conducted in 5 target regions

actual.value: 2019:Because of late release of the results of research discussion on TV production started late and though progressed a little, those will be finalized in 2020 along with local initiatives in regions.

title.narrative: HRDO has improved capacity and mechanism for doing independent child rights monitoring

baseline.value: HRDO roles and responsibilities mention independent child rights monitoring as one of their functions, and child rights unit exists.

target.value: 2020:HRDO conducts regular child rights monitoring based on systematized methodological framework

actual.value: 2019:Report with suggestions on independent monitoring of child rights by HRDO was finalized and accepted by HRDO colleagues, however training was postponed for several reasons. There is a need to better localize the indicators and clearly identify sources for which a local consultant would be needed.

title.narrative: Ratio of child-focused SDG indicators measured (standard indicators) by country disaggregated by sex and/or age

baseline.value: Out of 81 child-focused SDG indicators 37% are considered to be measured as per global indicator definition

target.value: 2020:At least 35% of child-focused SDG indicators are measured as per global indicator definition and at least half of those can be disaggregated by sex and/or age

actual.value: 2019:As of 2019 the ratio is the same, as no new indicators were measured.

title.narrative: The extent to which the state coordination mechanism for child-rights implementation with clearly defined roles and responsibilities for CRM is functional

baseline.value: Weak: committee for child rights is not functional, monitoring is mentioned as its function, but there is no mechanism for its implementation

target.value: 2020:Moderate: the role of CR coordination mechanism is clearly defined by law and includes secretariat and other mechanisms for being operational

actual.value: 2019:Commission on the rights of the child was revitalized with changes in the description clearly stating monitoring of child rights as one of the functions of the Commission. First meeting took place in 2019.
